result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joy C Ahlstrom

defendant.name: Ahlstrom, Joy C
defendant.address: S90 W22910 Rose Ave, Big Bend, WI 53103

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:29 AM
Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Joy C Ahlstrom.
Defendant Joy C Ahlstrom in court.  
Victim in court by zoom.
Victim Representative in court by zoom.

State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordinance of Disorderly Conduct, Statute 13-102(c)(8).
Defendant has no objections.  Court grants the amendment.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
Domestic Abuse Surcharge:  $100.00
To be paid at the rate of $15.00 per month, starting 10-15-2022 and the 15th of every month until paid in full.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
filed by the State
filed by the State
Trial Scheduling Order signed by Judge Melvin on 7-13-2022

Jury status hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:31 AM   File not called on the record.
Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joy C Ahlstrom in court by zoom with attorney Jessica A Klein.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Klein requests that the case be put on the trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant is to have no contact with the victim or his residence.
Defendant may go to the residence to get her belongings with an escort of an Officer with arrangement that she would need to make.
Defendant to have no contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. 
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 
Defendant is not to discuss this case with the Victim.

Case called at 2:06 PM 
Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joy C Ahlstrom in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  
Victim appeared in court.
State indicates that the Victim is requesting that the defendant have no contact with the residence.
Attorney Klein requests that her client be able to stay at the residence.
Court will Modify the Conditions of the Signature Bond.
  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 9:59 AM 
Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joy C Ahlstrom in court with attorney Jessica A Klein. 
Victim Witness Representative appeared in court. 
Victim appeared in court.
Court to address the conditions of bail/bond.
Attorney Klein makes statements and requests that the condition of no violent contact continue.
State requests that the bail modification of no contact be put back into place.
Victim makes statements.
Court will grant the victim's request to reinstate the no contact with the victim.
Bail/bond hearing on April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no violent contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. 
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 
Defendant is not to discuss this case with the Victim.

Case called at 9:20 AM 
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joy C Ahlstrom in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  
Attorney Klein requests that the conditions of bail be modified to no violent contact with Victim A.
State objects to this motion.
Court will grant the motion.
Defendant is to have no violation contact with Victim A.
Defendant is not to discuss this case with Victim A.
Defendant to sign a new bond.
Bail/bond hearing on April 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty. Jessica Klein
Hearing on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Amended to Signature Bond. Refund bond to poster.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one visit to the residence with police officer present to obtain her personal possessions.

08:54 AM Defendant Joy C Ahlstrom in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  If no contact with victim condition wishes to be amended it can be brought back befor this court.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
